Posts.Content: Hi Yvonne17, the Letrozole is to try to risk reduce, so to reduce the risk of the cancer coming back. Your cancer must have been Oestrogen positive, the Letrozole reduces the Oestrogen in your body. How long have you been taking it? Best wishes x
Posts.Title: Letrozole are dreadful

Posts.Content: My advice is to try to take one day at a time, every day is different and if you are struggling on one day the next might be better. Drink and drink and then some more if water tastes vile try different flavours of squash, your preference may change. Don't suffer side effects, tell the hospital or your GP and they will help. Please try to not worry and think of chemo as your friend. Very best wishes x
Posts.Title: Starting chemo in 11 days.....

Posts.Content: Hi LD64, Don't be scared of chemo, if you do need it look after yourself and follow the instructions from the unit. I won't lie it is not nice but for me it was only really hard towards the end. Thinking of you x
Posts.Title: How much should stats play a part in the decision to have chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi Sarah, I have read your posts and for what it is worth I think you have made the right decision, chemo means that you can also have Herceptin, which is good. I had to make a decision about rads, surgery or just monitoring, I asked the oncologist that if she had my diagnosis what she would do. Thinking of you and sending very best wishes. x
Posts.Title: How much should stats play a part in the decision to have chemo?

Posts.Content: Hi Skippy, I had the injections, 8 planned for each round of chemo, I felt like I had been run over by a bus but then the bus reversed back over me. I felt so ill I only had 7 injections after chemo 5 and 5 after chemo 6. My bloods however were really good thanks to the injections and all my chemo went ahead on time. Best wishes to your sister. x
Posts.Title: Lenograstin injection

Posts.Content: Hi Kim, Mine did this as well, mostly right but sometimes left, it is starting to get less and less times in the day now 4 weeks after last Tax. Pleased to hear you are managing fine. Best Wishes
Posts.Title: Weird side effects that no one tells you about!

Posts.Content: Hi Andrea, I would have been fine driving for chemo but would have really struggled for radio, possibly due to the distance. Best wishes x
Posts.Title: driving

Posts.Content: Hi Wendy, It worked for me and I had Fec-T, if it works it is worth it as it does protect your hair. Looking at my hair you would never know I had chemo last year. Best Wishes Sarah
Posts.Title: fec-t and cold cap

Posts.Content: Hi Kate, Emma and Julie, I have been taking Tamoxifen since the end of May, it was hell to start with particularly through radiotherapy which coincided with very warm weather, I thought I was going to combust and could not get up the stairs. I am taking Evening Primrose which I think has helped and I do exercise to help with the joint pain, I know they are working because if I miss a day I feel more stiff and more pain the next day. Thinking of you all, best wishes x
Posts.Title: Giving up Tomoxifen, right to wrong?

Posts.Content: Hi Rosalyn, Well done and I mean that from the bottom of my heart. I think our treatment is similar, I am taking Tamoxifen  and the main side effect is hot flushes, I have just started taking evening primrose to try and help, I will let you know whether it works. Best wishes
Posts.Title: last chemo!!!!!

Posts.Content: Hi Gem, I used the cold cap, I had shoulder length thick dark hair, about half of my hair came out throughout FEC, but started to grow again during Tax. I would say to you give it a go it does prolong the time there as the cap has to go on half an hour before treatment and stay on two and a half hours after. What it has also done is to keep my hair in good condition or that might be no straightening ! Best Wishes and I hope it goes well for you x
Posts.Title: cold cap??

Posts.Content: Hi Katie, I just wondered how far in you are, because when I had 4,5 and 6 I did not have a good week, only a few days and from 5 to 6 only 1 good day. Very best wishes x
Posts.Title: I'm knackered.......

Posts.Content: Hi Hairworries, I had FEC-T, the FEC was 100, so the highest dose they told me. I used the Paxman cold cap, my hair was thick, dark shoulder length, about half came out and I had patches particularly on the top of my head that were very thin, the cold cap is uncomfortable but only for me for the first 20 minutes, but everyone is different. The bit I struggled with which I did not know at the start is that hair can drop out at any point during treatment and for 3 weeks after the last chemo. Now the good bit my hair was in good condition throughout, it is now past shoulder length and thinner but looks good, I have coloured it twice and have very natural looking highlights from the chemo (it has white streaks) but with the colour kooks natural. It is your choice and your decision and a difficult one but I would do it for a 1% reduction in the risk. Very best wishes to you x Love
Posts.Title: CMF OR FEC WITH A COLD CAP?

Posts.Content: This may sound obvious, but have you tried drinking through a straw.
Posts.Title: Aversion to liquid! Help!

Posts.Content: Hi Marianne, I used the cold cap and it worked well for me, I just really wanted to warn you that you may still lose some of your hair, this made me panic a lot. I lost about half my hair but I had a lot of very thick shoulder length hair to start with. Good luck with it, I can't say for you but it was worth it for me. If you would like any more info from me just ask. Best wishes x
Posts.Title: Hair worries

Posts.Content: Hi Future, You could try Evening Primrose, it seems to work for me to some degree. Best Wishes Sarah
Posts.Title: Side effects from Tamoxifen after nearly a year

Posts.Content: Hi Future, You could try Evening Primrose, it seems to work for me to some degree. Best Wishes Sarah
Posts.Title: Side effects from Tamoxifen after nearly a year

Posts.Content: Hi Karan, I tried to move my car today with the handbrake still on and I had a right panic last Thursday when I could not unlock my car, it turned out I was trying to get into the wrong car. Best wishes x
Posts.Title: Chemo brain

Posts.Content: Hi Claire9898, I was told to keep drinking lots of water at least 2 litres for the next 3 weeks for you and to keep applying the aquaus cream, you may get burns which can keep appearing for up to 3 weeks if this happens either see your GP or speak to the hospital, you might also feel very tired and have a sore throat. I finished 4 weeks ago and my onco. appt. is in September. Best Wishes x
Posts.Title: what happens after radiotherapy

Posts.Content: Hi Lindy, if you google ESA it will give you the info you need. One phone call and they were really helpful, they have paid me up till I went back to work. When you start rads drink at least 2 litres of water every day and try and rest when you can. Thinking of you  x
Posts.Title: Exhaustion after chemo

Posts.Content: Hi Nonrag, your post made me smile, the bit about the cold cap, I felt cut off from everyone as i could not hear either. Different medication is given for different chemo to try to decrease the potential side effects. So as well as taking oral anti-sickness tablets and steroids you will probably be given them IV. Metoclopramide is anti-sickness and I think DE is Dexamethazone although I have never seen it written like that before I had oral steroids to take the day before my last 3 cycles of Tax. All hospitals do things slightly differently all that really matters is that you are ok and if not contact them because they can and will help you. Best Wishes x
Posts.Title: steroids?

Posts.Content: Hi Sarsh. I am needle phobic but was determined to do the injections myself (I am a nurse) , the first one I was all set but then could not stand looking at the needle in my stomach, so shut my eyes, the needle went in my finger, the blood shot up to the ceiling and I was so shocked I dropped the needle, which bent it. You will be pleased to hear that I have injected hundreds of other people and never had a problem but thought my experience would make you smile. Thinking of you Love
Posts.Title: Epic fail lol

Posts.Content: Hi Sally, if you haven't already, just ring, I know it is probably not the same hospital as me but when I did not ring and was worried they said that is what they are there for. I felt as though I was being a bit of a wuss and there were people needing them much more than me. I learnt and they were wonderful every time. Take care x
